conclusion: Determine the distance between the obstacle and the radar using time intervals and speed of light.
Radar emits radio waves with each emission lasting 1 microsecond.
Interval between two emissions is 100 microseconds.
Time between the start of one emission and the start of the next is 100 microseconds.
Total time for the round trip is 101 microseconds (1 microsecond emission + 100 microseconds interval).
Convert 101 microseconds to seconds: 1.01 x 10^-5 seconds.
Speed of light is 3.0 x 10^8 meters per second.
Distance for one round trip is 3.03 x 10^3 meters using speed of light and round trip time.
Distance to the obstacle is half of the round trip distance: 1515 meters.
Final answer is 757.5 meters, considering the problem's setup and figure.
